CatDescriptText: Mrs. Ola Stanton, 2127 Bedford Avenue, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 1, 1958, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that high school students should strike in order to air grievances or to gain their objectives?"  Answer reads: "I think not. There are other means of settling their grievances without defiance or arbitrary or antagonistic ways such as going on strike."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Ola Stanton wearing earrings and coat with four buttons at yoke, standing in front of store window with skin care items
